chargeHist.descr: Exposing Genitals/Pubic Area/Intimate Parts to a Child

result.execSummary:
The defendant Fredrick R. Grignon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Expose Child to Harmful Material, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.11(2)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is entitled to 68 days presentence credit if revoked.

miscConds.notes: Defendant to pay costs and DNA surcharge within the term of probation. Defendant to pay costs of supervision.
Defendant shall undergo and follow through with any counseling as recommended by Agent.

Defendant shall submit a DNA sample and pay surcharge.

Defendant shall register and comply with Sex Offender Registry for life.

in Dodge County Jail with Huber and Transfer to commence on or before 9/11/15.
Consecutive to: any other sentence previously imposed

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Fredrick R. Grignon in court, in custody with attorney Bradley J Jansen.  James T. Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Def. will plead today; victim rights complied with; Court reviews GPQPA & WOR; Court reviews charge/penalties; Court reviews recomm.; Def. pleads NC to Count 1; parties stip. to facts; Court finds plea made FV&I and finds Def. guilty of Expose Child to Harmful Material w/Counts 2 & 3 D&RI; State notes that he believe this is a mandatory sex offender registry violation; recess taken; Def. will proceed; State heard on recomm.; Atty. Jansen heard; Court imposes sentence; Atty. Jansen wants Def. released to be able to report later to finish jail; discussion held; Def. remanded

**W/H - 3 years PO - 68 days credit if revoked
- 60 days in DCJ w/H&Tr. to comm. 9/11/15
- $268 CC
- $250 DNA surcharge
- DNA sample
- Sex Offender Registry
- Counseling as deemed appropriate by Agent.
